channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [THRIFT-5410] CL build broken: Component :NET.DIDIERVERNA.CLON.TERMIO not found
item.description:
Unhandled ASDF/FIND-COMPONENT:MISSING-DEPENDENCY in thread #<SB-THREAD:THREAD "main thread" RUNNING
                                                              {10005205B3}>:
  Component :NET.DIDIERVERNA.CLON.TERMIO not found, required by
  #<SYSTEM "net.didierverna.clon">

Backtrace for: #<SB-THREAD:THREAD "main thread" RUNNING {10005205B3}>

unhandled condition in --disable-debugger mode, quitting
Makefile:626: recipe for target 'TestServer' failed
make[2]: *** [TestServer] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory '/thrift/src/test/cl'
Makefile:919: recipe for target 'precross-cl' failed

See also:

https://www.mail-archive.com/dev@thrift.apache.org/msg50775.html
item.summary: CL build broken: Component :NET.DIDIERVERNA.CLON.TERMIO not found

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: If there is no contributor stepping up I propose to deprecate and eventually remove CL support, as there is obviously no community interest of any significance.

Consider my fixes in branch https://github.com/m-g-r/thrift/tree/THRIFT-5410 which should alleviate this problem.

Please not that this only applies if https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-5501 is reverted first, as that removed the Common Lisp support.

 

Cheers, Max

Could you send a PR consisting of 2 commits?

  • revert CL removal
  • your new additions/changes/fixes
Okay. Updated to latest master, and available as https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/2646.

Does that trigger a build of that branch by Travis already? Or how would one test that the CI runs on the test servers without errors now? I just checked that `make check` runs for me now with Common Lisp (cl) included.

Update: I notice that yes, it currently is Travis CI as a pull request build.
